word.entryDescription: in a place nearby indicated by the speaker
word.entryExample: Can you stand next to your friend over there?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to make a picture using paint
word.entryExample: Paint some pink flowers on your bowl.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a picture made with paint
word.entryExample: There's a very big painting on the wall next to the window.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a big grand building usually designed for a king or queen
word.entryExample: The king isn't in the palace at the moment.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a metal round container with a long handle you use for cooking food
word.entryExample: My mum fries eggs in a pan.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large black and white animal like a bear that lives in China and eats mostly bamboo
word.entryExample: Pandas live in China.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: thin, flat material made from crushed wood or cloth, used for writing, printing, or drawing on
word.entryExample: Did you remember to buy some paper in the shop?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: your mother and father
word.entryExample: My parents are both teachers.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a tropical bird with a hooked beak and usually colourful feathers, which can be trained to copy human speech
word.entryExample: Polly the parrot wanted to look for treasure.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a social event where people get together to have fun by eating, drinking, dancing, etc
word.entryExample: Can you come to my party on Saturday?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a food made from flour, eggs and water, and made into different shapes
word.entryExample: In Italy we eat pasta very often.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very small round green vegetable
word.entryExample: I'd like peas with my fish and chips.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a round fruit with a narrow top, a thin green skin and white flesh
word.entryExample: There are pears on the tree in our garden.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a long thin object with ink inside it that you use for writing and drawing on paper
word.entryExample: Can I use your pen?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a long thin object made of wood with a hard centre you use for writing and drawing on paper
word.entryExample: Ben draws pictures with his pencils.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a bag or box which you keep pens and pencils in
word.entryExample: I keep my pencil case at school.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a black and white sea bird with small wings that cannot fly but swims very well
word.entryExample: The mom penguin is giving food to her baby.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: men, women, and children
word.entryExample: London's got more people than my hometown.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an animal you keep at home
word.entryExample: I have a pet parrot.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a shop that sells animals and supplies for them
word.entryExample: What do you need from the pet shop?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an object we use to speak to someone in a different place
word.entryExample: What is your phone number?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: short for 'photograph' - a picture taken with a camera
word.entryExample: We took all these photos on our trip to America.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large musical instrument with black and white keys which you press with your fingers
word.entryExample: Can Alex play the piano?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to take something from the floor or another surface
word.entryExample: Please pick up your toys!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a meal which you take away from your home and eat outside
word.entryExample: We had a picnic by the side of the lake.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a painting, drawing or photograph
word.entryExample: This is a picture of my family.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a young pig
word.entryExample: Look at these little piglets – they're so lovely!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large tropical fruit with narrow green leaves, thick brown skin and juicy yellow flesh
word.entryExample: We ate pineapple at our picnic.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is pink is a colour between red and white
word.entryExample: Pink is my favourite colour.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: somebody who attacks ships at sea in order to steal things or commit other illegal acts
word.entryExample: Pirates have just captured a ship off the coast of Somalia.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large round flat dish with a bread base, baked with tomato, cheese and other food
word.entryExample: At the party there's pizza and lemonade.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an area of land or a building that you go to
word.entryExample: There are many places of interest in this city.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a vehicle with wings and an engine that flies in the sky
word.entryExample: I don't like travelling by plane.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an extremely large round object which moves around the sun or another star
word.entryExample: We all live on planet Earth.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a type of small tree with leaves that often produces flowers or fruit
word.entryExample: My mother has some nice plants in the living room.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a flat round object you put food on
word.entryExample: Watch out – the plate's hot.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: 1. to take part in a sport or game 2. to perform music on an instrument or instruments 3. to play games or have fun
word.entryExample: 1. I love playing sport. 2. My brother plays the drums in a band. 3. Can I play with my friends in the park today?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to play a team sport in which people try to kick a ball into a goal
word.entryExample: I play football every day.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an outside area at a school where the children can play
word.entryExample: The children are playing football in the playground.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something you say to make a request more polite
word.entryExample: Can you repeat that, please?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large white bear that lives in the far north
word.entryExample: Polar bears are white.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an area of water smaller than a lake
word.entryExample: We have a small pond in our garden.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large area filled with water and used for swimming or playing in
word.entryExample: I didn't swim in the pool yesterday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a card with a picture on one side, and a place to write on the other side which you send to someone by post
word.entryExample: I've got a postcard from my friends in America.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a deep round container with an open top
word.entryExample: You can paint some birds on the pot to make it more beautiful.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a round vegetable with thin skin and hard white flesh, which grows underground
word.entryExample: We had sausages and potatoes for dinner.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something you give to somebody, often on a special occasion such as a birthday
word.entryExample: Sally's got lots of birthday presents.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: good-looking, especially a girl or young woman
word.entryExample: This dress is very pretty.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the son of a king, queen or prince
word.entryExample: The prince looked for Cinderella.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something you watch on television or listen to on the radio
word.entryExample: There's an interesting programme about sharks on TV.
word.label: ydp
